data.title: Bad Karma by Paul Wilson
data.meta_description: Need a new read? Try Bad Karma by Paul Wilson, it's the true story of a mexican surf trip from hell. Read my review of Bad Karma on the Surfer Dad blog.
data.text:
Can you remember the worst surf trip you ever had? Paul Wilson can, but he had to wait for the statute of limitations to expire before he could tell his tale.

It was the summer of â€˜78, the year Big Wednesday was released, and for SoCal surfers Mexico was the place to go.

The Mexican border was just a 10 minute drive, but a trip to Baja was not enough to get your cool credentials. So when Jelly and Moose (the coolest guys on the block) invited him and his Wonderbus on a 2,000m road trip to La Ticla, Mainland Mexico â€“ he jumped at the chance.

Mexico was a ticket to freedom and adventure.

Why all the bad karma?

Every character played their part.

Opters the thief. He robbed his employers to pay for the Mexican adventure and bought a stolen camera from a drug addict to document the trip.

Moose the murderer. He skipped bail to dodge a manslaughter charge.

Jelly the unscrupulous cad. He abandoned his pregnant girlfriend without warning.

For Opters his bad karma haunted him throughout the trip, with:

â€¢ at least 4 near-death experiences including shark, flood, poisoning and police chase

â€¢ his beloved Wonderbus actually dying, at least 4 times

â€¢ his travel companions using and abusing him

â€¢ only one surf session in the entire trip.

But thereâ€™s also good karma for Opters as he:

â€¢ gains humility and a better understanding of karma

â€¢ shares friendly beers with El Chapo (yep, The El Chapo)

â€¢ gets his cool credentials.

His travelling companions donâ€™t seem to benefit so much in the long run, as the end credits for the main characters paint a sorry picture. But our anti-hero Opters survives and evidently thrives ðŸ™‚

When Bad Karma turns good
